channel.title: Strange Frequencies Radio
channel.description: Join Hosts Bobby Nelson, Jason Korbus and Robyn McKinney as they tackle all things paranormal, from ghosts to UFO's from ITC to EVP and all the creatures in between.

channel.itunes:author: Strange Frequencies Radio
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Best paranormal podcast around
channel.itunes:summary:
Strange Frequencies Radio is an internet radio broadcast, airing each Sunday afternoon from 3-6pm Eastern. We aim to cover not only paranormal topics, but also anything that may be considered fringe, or otherwise unique and interesting. This may include, but is certainly not limited to: ghosts and monsters, UFOs, conspiracy theories, unusual hobbies or professions, flat earth proponents, psychic phenomena, urban legends, therianthropes, Young Earth creationism, science, skepticism, and much much more.
Our goal for each and every episode of Strange Frequencies Radio is simple: to provide 3 hours of informative, opinionated and fun internet talk radio that engages and enlightens both ourselves and our listeners.
Whatever it is, we're here and ready to listen. Email us at StrangeFrequenciesRadio@live.com and tell us what is on your mind.
channel.itunes:keywords: Paranormal, Spirits, UFO's, Cryptids, cryptozoology, Ufology, fortean, strange, bizarre, Ghosts, science, skeptic

item.title: Episode 134 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines around the world, get into a discussion about some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the phone lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with Stephen Hill. Steve is an old friend of the show and a big proponent of what the paranormal world calls ITC, particularly "ghost boxes;" radios redesigned to allow for direct communication with spirits, or some other discarnate entity. Stephen has written a book about his true experience with a haunting titled "Something Unseen," which is available on Amazon.com in paperback or Kindle form.

At 5pm Eastern we'll talk to Robert McLuhan. Robert is an Oxford educated freelance journalist and longtime member of the Society for Psychical Research. Mr. McLuhan has written a book called "Randi's Prize" which, as the subtitle suggests, takes a look at what skeptics say about the paranormal, why they are wrong, and why it matters. "Randi's Prize is available online through Amazon.com is either paperback or Kindle form.
item.itunes:author: Strange Frequencies Radio
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 134 - We speak to Steve Hill about his new book Something Unseen, ITC and electronic mediumship, then we speak with Robert McLuhan about his book "Randi's Prize" and parapsychology

item.title: Episode 132 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines around the world, get in...to a discussion about some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the phone lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with Gina Lanier. Much like a box of chocolates, when you enter the world of Gina Lanier, you never know what you're gonna get. The last time we spoke with her we talked about ghost hunting, yes; but also explored the taboo topic of sex with ghosts and even heard Gina's own account of meeting the Devil face to face. She's back today with more tales of high strangeness. To find out more about her, check out WWW.GINALANIER.COM

At 5pm Eastern we'll speak with Sherry Shriner. Certainly not one to pull punches, Sherry Shriner is the UFC of internet radio commentators - no holds are barred. Whether discussing the New World Order and Satanism or UFOs as Fallen Angels, you'll get her brand of medicine straight, to the point, and without the metaphorical spoonful of sugar to help it go down. To learn more about Sherry and her projects, check out WWW.SHERRYSHRINER.COM

item.title: Episode 127 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines aroun...d the world, get into a discussion about some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the phone lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with comic writer Dirk Manning. Dirk devoted years of his life to the writing of Nightmare World, a collection of short stories in comic book format that touched on elements of horror and psychology. Collections of Volume 1 and 2 are available from Amazon.com, and you can check out his new series: Countdown To Extinction and A Rush of Blood to the Head by creating a free account at WWW.COMICSPIPELINE.COM

At 5pm Eastern we'll talk to Howie Noel. Howie is a cartoonist, and comic empresario whose strip, "TaraNormal" can be seen regularly in each new issue of TAPS Paramagazine, the official mag of SyFy channel's Ghost Hunters. To learn more about Howie and his work, surf on over to WWW.TARANORMAL.COM

item.title: Episode 126 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
12/12/10 - Dr. Paul Kurtz & Nathan Schoonover
***CLICK "GO LIVE" ABOVE FOR AUDIO, VIDEO, AND CHAT ***

Strange Frequencies Radio is LIVE this Sunday at 3pm Eastern for yet another round of the most informative, opinionated and informative 3 hours of paranormal talk online. And you are invited!

The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines around the world, get into a discussion about some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the phone lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with Nathan Schoonover, also known as The Demon Hunter. Nathan has a longtime interest in the paranormal that has led him far and wide in search of the answers. Along the way he has been involved in radio, along with Shaun Burris on The Ghostman and Demon Hunter Show. And television, where he starred in the A&E special "Extreme Paranormal." For more information on Nathan, head over to: WWW.GHOSTANDDEMON.COM

At 5pm Eastern we'll talk to Dr. Paul Kurtz. Dr. Kurtz is the professor Emeritus of Philosophy at the State University of New York as well as the founder of the Center For Inquiry and Council for Secular Humanism. He is the author of hundreds of articles and over 50 books, the latest of which, "Exuberant Skepticism," is a collection of writings centered on common sense, reason, skepticism, and science. To learn more about Dr. Kurtz, his personal website is located at: WWW.PAULKURTZ.NET

It's going to be a great show, FREQS; chock full of the kind of paranormal talk you don't find elsewhere on the interwebs. You want unique? You want fun? You want opinion? Strange Frequencies Radio is the place to find it. See you Sunday!

item.title: Episode 124 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines around the world, get into a discussion about some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the phone lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with Keith Chester. Keith has written a book called "Strange Company: Military Encounters with UFOs in World War 2." The book, which is available through Amazon.com where it has received positive reviews, discusses in-depth a phenomenon that came to be known as Foo Fighters. What were these objects which seemed to follow and interfere with our fighter pilots? When did they arrive? Where did they come from?

At 5pm Eastern we'll talk to Dr. Raymond Moody. Moody is an author, lecturer and counselor whose case studies of people who experienced "clinical death" and were revived coined and popularized the concept of the Near Death Experience. With books such as "Life After Life" and "Reunions," Dr. Moody has been established as a leading authority on the subject. His newest book, "Glimpses of Eternity" is available now. For more information, check out WWW.LIFEAFTERLIFE.COM

item.title: Episode 118 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
Strange Frequencies Radio is LIVE this Sunday at 3pm Eastern, and guess what? IT'S OTHERWORLD CONTACT DAY!! That's right, we'll be celebrating and doing our best to invite creatures from other worlds into our own on 10/10/10. Won't you join us and see what kind of trouble we can all get into?

The show kicks off with our free talk segment. This is where we gab about the latest weird and bizarre news pulled from headlines around the world, get into a discussion out some topic, paranormal or otherwise, and maybe even open the line lines to get your opinions on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we'll speak with Micah Hanks. Micah is a researcher and writer on strange scientific discoveries and political topics, contributing to publications such as FATE, Fortean Time, and UFO Magazine, among others. He is the author of the book, "Magic, Mysticism & the Molecule," which takes a unique look at altered states of consciousness, psychedelic drugs, and the similarities from archetypal folklore from around the world. He created and maintains The Gralien Report, an online resource which for, as the website states, "weird news, anomalies, and Exopolitics from beyond the fringe." Find out more information on Micah and his projects by surfing over to WWW.GRALIENREPORT.COM

At 5pm Eastern we will welcome back Nick Redfern. Nick is a writer and investigator into a variety of Fortean topics, ranging from Bigfoot, Chupacabra, and Big Cats all the way to Extraterrestrials, and yes, even uncovered government secrets from around the world. He has published books such as "There's Something in the Woods" and "Three Men Seeking Monsters," and discusses all things weird and bizarre with our mutual pal Raven Meindel on their internet radio show and podcast "Exploring All Realms" on the Ape-X Radio Network. His latest books are "Monsters of Texas," co-written with Ken Gerhard, and "Final Events," which explores a secret government group on matters of Demonic UFOs and the Afterlife. If you want more information, your one stop source for all things Redfern is online at WWW.NICKREDFERN.COM

It's going to be a fun, informative and entertaining 3 hours, FREQS. Not only will it be jam packed with some of the best paranormal talk online, but we may even make contact with an otherworld entity or two. Be sure to hop in our chat room and join in on the discussion. It shall be…EPIC!!!!

item.title: Episode 117 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
Strange Frequencies Radio is LIVE this Sunday at 3pm Eastern. And in our never-ending quest to bring you diverse and well-rounded paranormal discussions, we will speak with both an average Joe in a local ghost hunting group, as well as a fella whose tales of UFO sightings and close encounters with Extraterrestrials have captured the imagination of many.

We kick off the show with our free talk segment. During this first hour we will chat aimlessly about this, that and the other. Included is usually weird and bizarre news ripped from the headlines around the world, and discussion of a paranormal nature where we may even take your calls to get your take on the issues of the day.

At 4pm Eastern we will speak with our first guest, Bob Gilmer. Bob is an unashamed paranormal enthusiast who works with tech and does investigations with Wichita Paranormal Research Society. Check them out online by visiting WWW.WICHITAPARANORMAL.COM

At 5pm Eastern we will speak with Stan Romanek. Mr. Romanek's first person account of UFO sightings, visitation and, ultimately, abduction has captivated many. His story has been profiled on radio and on television, including CNN, and is the subject of his own book, which is entitled "Messages." If you would like more information about Stan, visit him online at WWW.STANROMANEK.COM

It'll be a good show, freqs; full of information, opinion, and fun. Be sure to join us live in the chat room to interact with other listeners and the hosts of SFR. Hope to see ya there!

item.title: Episode 115 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
Strange Frequencies Radio is LIVE this Sunday at 3pm Eastern. We'll be talking about Dragon*Con, monsters, mayhem…and the 9/11 Truth campaign. Yeah, that's how we rock here on SFR.

We kick off the show with our free talk segment where we typically ramble aimlessly, talk about weird and bizarre news from recent headlines around the world, and get into a discussion which is sure to get people riled up. We may even open the phone lines to take your calls.

At 4pm Eastern we'll welcome our first guest, Blake Smith. Blake is the host of Monstertalk, the free podcast which critically examines the science behind cryptozoological and legendary creatures such as Bigfoot, the Loch Ness Monster, or Werewolves. Found online at Skeptic.com and iTunes, Monstertalk promises, unlike many mystery-mongering shows, to give skepticism more than just a few minutes of lip service. Blake can be found online at Facebook and Twitter, and a variety of other places by simply Googling "Doctor Atlantis."

At 5pm Eastern we will speak with Mike Berger. Mr. Berger is on the website advisory board for 911Truth.org, holder of a degree in Sociology, as well as owning a video production company. Mike began his doubting of the official 9/11 story 14 months after the event. Since then he has directed the film "Improbable Collapse," which purports to be the first film to look at the events of September 11, 2001 from a scientific perspective. You can find out more information about the film at WWW.IMPROBABLECOLLAPSE.COM and about the 9/11 Truth campaign at WWW.911TRUTH.ORG

It's going to be a fun show, with topics that cover the paranormal as well as the hot button issue of 9/11. Be sure to join in on the conversation in our live chat room to have your opinion heard. See ya Sunday, you buncha Freqs.

item.title: Episode 114 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
We most always kick off the show with our free talk segment, where you can expect to hear playful banter between the hosts, as well as discussion about news pulled from headlines around the world. We may even open up the phone lines to take your calls.

At 5pm Eastern we'll be joined by Steven LaChance, whose first person account of surviving a violent haunting at the location now known as the Union Screaming House has been profiled on the Discovery Channel series "A Haunting" in the episode "Fear House," as well as Steven's own book, "The UnInvited." Steven uses his prior experiences to help others who are currently undergoing similar traumas. You can ind out more information about all this and more at: WWW.STEVENALACHANCE.COM

It's gonna be a tremendous show. Be sure to tune in and join the always lively discussion in the chat room, where the conversation flows as freely as the blood from Dexter Morgan's kill sites. Yes, that's a TV reference, kids. See ya Sunday, freqs!

item.title: Episode 113 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description:
We most always kick off the show with our free
talk segment, where you can expect to hear playful banter between the
hosts, as well as discussion about news pulled from headlines around
the world. We'll also be giving away a copy of Kenny Feder's book
"Frauds, Myths, and Mysteries: Science and Pseudoscience in
Archaeology." So, you better be there if you want to win!!

At
4pm Eastern we will welcome in Gina Lanier. Gina is a paranormal
investigator who has been called a "ghost hunter's ghost hunter," and
is thought by some to be among the most knowledgeable in "the field"
today. Today we will be talking to her about her craft, as well as a
topic considered to be a taboo: the mysteries of Sex With Ghosts. Her
investigations have been profiled online at Haunted America Tours, and
you can find more information about Gina at her personal website,
WWW.GINALANIER.COM

At 5pm Eastern we'll be joined by Travis
Walton. In November of 1975, Mr Walton was the victim of one of the
most widely known cases of extraterrestrial abduction that has ever
been reported. His story, profiled in the book "The Walton Experience"
inspired the film version in the title that this incident is best known
by: "Fire in the Sky." Travis' book, which has been re-titled "Fire in
the Sky: The Walton Experience" is currently out of print, but may be
available at libraries and through online retailers. For more
information about Travis and his story, please visit his official
website at: WWW.TRAVIS-WALTON.COM

item.title: Episode 73 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 73 - Fantastic talk with Budd Hopkins, Author, Artist and founder of Intruders Foundation. Budd speaks about his Art, life and Alien Abduction cases along with his own sighting. This is a must listen!

item.title: Episode 72 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 72 - We start off in hour two with Alan Richardson, Aleister Crowley and Dion Fortune, and hour 3 we speak to Diane Powell the author of The ESP Enigma

item.title: Episode 71 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 71 - Heathyr Hoffman joins us from Ghost Hunters Academy as she talks bout her time on the show, her idea's about the field as it stands, and mediumship.

item.title: Episode 70 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 70 - Happy New Year! We kick off 2010 with our 1st annual Listener awards, and if that wasn't amazing enough, we bring you Mitch Silverstein of Nyack Paranormal to discuss his adaptations to current equipment used in investigating.

item.title: Episode 69 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 69 - Back again was Commander Sanni Ceto, Because of our technical difficulties we had to have her back we didn't want the listeners to miss out on all of her information.

item.title: Episode 68 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 68 - Joining us again is Commander Sanni Ceto, who believes she is a human/Alien Hybrid. we had some techical difficulties this show there are missing parts in hours 1 and 2 - This is guest hosted with us by Shannon Slyvia

item.title: Episode 67 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 67 - We talk to Dr. Stephen Rorke about Spiritcon and his research on the possible hoax of what is considered some of the most compelling ITC evidence.

item.title: Episode 66 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 66 - Join us for 2 hours of free talk then our fun conversation with author of the Flagglers Few Graphic novel Andre Frattino

item.title: Episode 65 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 65 - Join us as we talk to Shannon Sylvia from Season 1 of Ghost Hunters International about her new equipment, her time on GHI and other paranormal adventures.

item.title: Episode 64 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 64 -We talk to Donna Stewart the host of Psi Fi Para Radio and joining us the 3rd hour is Paranormal Tv Network's "Haunted Hillbillies" host Steve (The Electronic Medium) Hill, talking to us about ghost box communication and sharing with us some of his recordings

item.title: Episode 62 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 62 - We talk to Louis about Al Capones terror haunting and about his book "Al Capone the Last Days: A Terror Haunting.". Then we speak to Patrick H.T. Doyle about Haunted Hoax, Oultier Radio and his book Series Edgar Font

item.title: Episode 61 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 61 - We speak with Jason Gowin, Star of the highly debated A&E's Extreme Paranormal

item.title: Episode 60 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 60 - We speak with T. Patrick Rooney about Zombies and explore the Fakes in the field with www.SciFake.com creator Ron Tebo

item.title: Episode 59 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 59 - We speak with Greg Newkirk founder and editor of www.whofortedblog.com

item.title: Episode 58 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 58 Join us as we speak to Parapsychologist and Author Loyd Auerbach and hear him admit he is a Jedi.

item.title: Episode 57 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 57 Join us as we talk to Debra Pickmen as seen on "Sightings" Debra tells us about her life in the Sallie House, Debra joins us for the full 2 hours.

item.title: Episode 56 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 56 we talk with Ouija historian and creator of www.williamfuld.com, Robert Murch.

item.title: Episode 55 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 57 in Hour 2 we speak to Esther Luttrell the author of the book "Dear Dean, Love Mom" a true story of her deceased son's will to bring her messages from beyond. Hour three we have a surprise appearance by our good friend Kenny Biddle of PIRA speaking about his ideas on some of the equipment currently being used in paranormal investigations.

item.title: Episode 54 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 54 - We talk UFO's with William Konkolesky the Director of the Michigan MUFON chapter

item.title: Episode 53 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 53 - We speak Near Death Experiences with Dr. Atwater

item.title: Episode 52 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 52 - In hour 2 we speak with Magus Peter H. Gilmore the High Priest of the Church of Satan

item.title: Episode 51 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 51 -The always lovely Marie D. Jones returns to discuss the ideas put forth in her latest book, "The Resonance Key."

item.title: Episode 50 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 50 - We talk with Nick Redfern about his latest book, "Science Fiction Secrets" and, of course, monsters!

item.title: Episode 49 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 49 - Spirit Photography and the Ghosts of Chicago are the topic as we welcome in Ghost Research Society President and Founder Dale Kaczmarek.

item.title: Episode 48 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 48 - Aside from the Zapruder Film, has any other piece of footage been analyzed as much as the Patterson Gimlin Bigfoot Film? We get the opinion of Jeff Hilling about its authenticity. We also welcome back Vince Wilson to talk Ghost Tech and Ghost Science, and to ruffle the feathers of the paranormal establishment.

item.title: Episode 47 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 47 - We discuss the always controversial Frank's Box with researcher Steve Hultay.

item.title: Episode 46 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 46 - Jason Gowin returns to give us a sneak peek of his upcoming A&E program "Extreme Paranormal" and to recount some of the fun we had together at the Mothman Festival. We also talk to Nick Spantgos of Paranormal Research Investigators about ghost investigation.

item.title: Episode 45 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 45 - Dave Schrader, host of Darkness Radio, is our guest and talks about his book "The Other Side," his upcoming stint as Ghost Adventures Live correspondent, and offers up some tips for doing a good paranormal talk show to the crew.

item.title: Episode 44 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 44 - Dr. Jaysen Rand returns to talk about "The Return of Planet X

item.title: Episode 43 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 43 - In our first ever Wednesday evening show, Rosemary Ellen Guiley drops by to discuss everything from Shadow People to Demons and Frank's Box communication.

item.title: Episode 42 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 42 - We talk Tarot with Scotty Roberts and tiptoe through the Shadow World with "Real Vampires" author and living legend Brad Steiger

item.title: Episode 41 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 41 - We're back LIVE from Fort Mifflin in Philadelphia at the "Save Fort Mifflin" event. Our guests include John Zaffis, Shannon Sylvia, Tony Selletti and Paul Michael Kane

item.title: Episode 40 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 40 - We laugh with "paranormal comedian" Mike Brody who talks about some of his recent adventures in ghost hunting, and we also get crazy with the directors of "Children of the Grave" and "The Possessed" the Booth Brothers.

item.title: Episode 39 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 39 - We get a lesson in fact and myth from Eastern State Penitentiary historian Paul Kahan who is the author of "Eastern State Penitentiary: A History." We also talk Demonology with former TAPS/Ghost Hunters star, and author of "Paranormal Realities," Keith Johnson

item.title: Episode 38 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 38 - The life and times of a spirit medium with Barb Mallon. We also welcome in Ken Gerhard to talk about the thrill of a monster hunt.

item.title: Episode 37 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 37 - We explore the adventures of the charismatic medium Gavin Cromwell. We also welcome back the always intriguing Sanni Ceto to tell her story of being both the reincarnation of an alien who crashed at Roswell, and a hybrid alien in human form.

item.title: Episode 36 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 36 - - Dr. Jaysen Rand warns us of the impending doom foretold in his book "The Return of Planet X." We also talk with the very engaging star of "UFO Hunters" and the publisher of UFO Magazine, Bill Birnes.

item.title: Episode 35 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 35 - is our guest as we talk "Coast to Coast Ghosts" and she recounts some of her favorite ghost stories…as well as the time her mom introduced her to Ted Bundy

item.title: Episode 34 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 34 - Bernie Tocholke tells us about his life in, and subsequent escape from, a religious cult as chronicled in his book "Torn Asunder." We also talk 2012 and Time Prompt Phenomenon with Fortean writer Marie D. Jones

item.title: Episode 33 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 33 - We explore the history and haunting of Bobby Mackey's Music World with the great Bobby Mackey himself. We also talk to Tim Yancey, host of the Encounters Paranormal Radio Series, about his life and times in the paranormal.

item.title: Episode 32 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 32 - We talk to Andre Frattino about his upcoming "Flagler's Few" ghost hunter themed comic book. And we delve deep into the story of the Watseka Wonder with Roff Home owner John Whitman.

item.title: Episode 31 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 31 - Jason Gowin tells us about his life in the paranormal, including being mentored by "Amityville Horror" experiencer George Lutz. We also take a walk through the Shadowlands with Dave Juliano

item.title: Episode 30 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 30 - We celebrate Father's Day with a visit from foremost Near Death Experience researcher, and author of "Life After Life" Dr. Raymond Moody. We also have a discussion of Orbs with Mark Davis.

item.title: Episode 29 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 29 - Pamela K. Kinney drops by to discuss the hauntings of Virginia. and ghost tech with Vince Wilson

item.title: Episode 28 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 28 - K. Paul Johnson discusses Theosophy and the Modern Spiritualist movement with us.

item.title: Episode 27 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 27 - We talk creepy crawlers and crytpids with Michigan rep of the Center for Fortean Zoology Kathleen "Raven" Meindel, and talk to "Dark Force" author Bill Bean about surviving a violent haunting

item.title: Episode 26 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 26 - Robyn McKinney drops in to discuss how the "Save Fort Mifflin" event went, and we also talk to Dr. Robert Schoch about his book "The Parapsychology Revolution."

item.title: Episode 25 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 25 -LIVE from Fort Mifflin with Robyn and Mark from PARA, as well as Shannon Sylvia, formerly of Ghost Hunters International.

item.title: Episode 24 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 24 -We explore the mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle with Gian Quasar, and fakery in the paranormal with Haunted Hoax host (and author of the Edgar Font book series) Patrick HT Doyle.

item.title: Episode 23 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 23 - Stacy Horn recounts the "Unbelievable" story of J.B. Rhine and the Duke Parapsychology lab. We also talk to Dr. Judy Griffin about Aromatherapy.

item.title: Episode 22 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 22 - We focus on psi today with the legendary Dr. William Roll who regales us with the cases that shaped his career, and we also talk to Dr. Boyce Batey of the ASPSI.

item.title: Episode 21 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 21 -It's all UFO talk as we talk with show favorite Commander Sanni Ceto who claims to be a hybrid Alien, and the reincarnation of the ET that crashed at Roswell. Col Jesse Marcel discusses his "Roswell Legacy."

item.title: Episode 20 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 20 -We talk folklore with S.E. Schlosser and hear stories from her "Spooky" book series. Jeff Belanger drops in to discuss his latest book and inject some much needed humor into the paranormal

item.title: Episode 19 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 19 -Wil Tracer stops by to explain why we never landed on the moon.

item.title: Episode 18 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 18 - R. Gary Patterson discusses Rock n Roll myths, legends, and curses. David Acord talks monsters and "The Cryptid Chrinicles"

item.title: Episode 17 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 17 - We search for Bigfoot and discuss hoaxes involving Tom Biscardi with Java Bob Schmalzbach. Brian Harnois, of Ghost Hunters and Ghost Hunters International fame discusses his time on the shows.

item.title: Episode 16 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 16 - We discuss the possibility of Extraterrestrial visitation with Stanton Friedman and discuss pandemics and epidemics with Epidemiologist Kevin Aston.

item.title: Episode 15 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 15 - welcome Lanaia Lee to discuss her book "Of Atlantis" and to answer for charges of plagiarism. We also talk to "Growing Up Haunted" author Alexandra Holzer.

item.title: Episode 14 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 14 - Anaesthetic Witch Monica Crimmins returns to talk about being a medium. We realize a dream by having Loyd Auerbach on the show to talk Parapsychology.

item.title: Episode 13 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 13 -Anthony Selletti discusses his book, "Fort Mifflin: A Paranormal History." We also welcome back Robyn McKinney to the program to talk about the upcoming "Save Fort Mifflin" event.

item.title: Episode 12 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 12 -Sherry Shriner warns us about the Reptilian invasion and the prophecies of Bible Code. We also talk ghost investigation with "Paranormal Southern Gentleman" Bob Hunnicut

item.title: Episode 11 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 11 -Near Death Experiences is the topic today. Our guest is "Saved by the Light" author and lecturer Dannion Brinkley.

item.title: Episode 10 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 10 -Beatrice Marot joins us to talk about psychic phenomenon and the feud with Chip Coffey. We also discuss the Beast of Bray Road with Linda Godfrey.

item.title: Episode 8 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 8 -We visit with Jeff Wamsley and talk the facts and legend of the Mothman. Also, Dave Considine drops by to discuss Demonology.

item.title: Episode 7 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 7 -We talk to Chip Coffey about psychic phenomenon, the Paranormal State controversies and his feud with Beatrice Marot. We discuss paranormal investigation with Quest Research Founder and "Ghost Diaries" star Tobin Wilkerson. We also tackle EVP with Mark and Debbie Constantinos.

item.title: Episode 6 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 6 - It's a very Merry Strange Frequencies Radio Christmas special. And what would Christmas be without investigator and skeptic extraordinaireJames Randi?

item.title: Episode 5 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 5 - We discuss hypocrisy in the paranormal field and claims of fakery on Paranormal State with "Eye on the Paranormal" blogger Kirby Robinson

item.title: Episode 4 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 4 - Cryptozoology and monster hunting is the topic with Fortean writer and investigator Nick Redfern.

item.title: Episode 3 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 3 - We discuss science & the paranormal with Stanford physicist Dr. Robert Cooper and talk ghost hunting with John Kachuba, author of "Ghost Hunting Ohio"

item.title: Episode 2 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 2 -We talk to "FormerGHFan" about the Ghost Hunters Halloween debacle. We also talk to medium Monica Crimmins, and discuss Demonology and Excorcism with Arch Bishop James Long.

item.title: Episode 1 - Strange Frequencies Radio
item.description: Episode 1 -Strange Frequencies Radio debuts by discussing the controversy surrounding Ghost Hunters "Collargate." Our guest is Robyn McKinney of My Ghost Network.
